metadata.title: NIST SP 800-171A Assessment Procedures — OSCAL Assessment Plan
metadata.remarks: Generated from SP 800-171A assessment procedures CSV with proper OSCAL structure and consistent control-id naming.

import-profile.remarks: Establishes catalog context for all related-controls references; required for cross-catalog validation.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1 – Limit system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices (including other systems). – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: Determine If:

steps.title: Examine
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Access control policy; procedures addressing account management; security plan; system design documentation; system configuration settings and associated documentation; list of active system accounts and the name of the individual associated with each account; list of conditions for group and role membership; notifications or records of recently transferred, separated, or terminated employees; list of recently disabled system accounts along with the name of the individual associated with each account; access authorization records; account management compliance reviews; system monitoring records; system audit logs and records; other relevant documents or records; list of devices and other systems authorized to connect to organizational systems].

steps.title: Interview
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Personnel with account management responsibilities; system or network administrators; personnel with information security responsibilities].

steps.title: Test
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Organizational processes for managing system accounts; mechanisms for implementing account management].

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1[a] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: authorized users are identified.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1[b] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: processes acting on behalf of authorized users are identified.

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: processes acting on behalf of authorized users are identified.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1[c] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: devices (including other systems) authorized to connect to the system are identified.

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: devices (including other systems) authorized to connect to the system are identified.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1[d] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: system access is limited to authorized users.

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: system access is limited to authorized users.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1[e] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: system access is limited to processes acting on behalf of authorized users.

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: system access is limited to processes acting on behalf of authorized users.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.1[f] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: system access is limited to authorized devices (including other systems).

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: system access is limited to authorized devices (including other systems).

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.2 – Limit system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute. – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: Determine If:

steps.title: Examine
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Access control policy; procedures addressing access enforcement; security plan; system design documentation; list of approved authorizations (user privileges) including remote access authorizations; system configuration settings and associated documentation; system audit logs and records; other relevant documents or records].

steps.title: Interview
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Personnel with access enforcement responsibilities; system or network administrators; personnel with information security responsibilities; system developers].

steps.title: Test
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Mechanisms implementing access control policy].

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.2[a] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute are defined

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute are defined

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.2[b] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: system access is limited to the defined types of transactions and functions for authorized users.

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: system access is limited to the defined types of transactions and functions for authorized users.

props.value: the duties of individuals requiring separation to reduce the risk of malevolent activity are defined.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.4[b] – (Access Control)

props.value: separate accounts for individuals whose duties and accesses must be separated to reduce the risk of malevolent activity or collusion are established

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.5 – Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts. – (Access Control)

steps.title: Examine
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Access control policy; procedures addressing account management; security plan; system design documentation; system configuration settings and associated documentation; list of active system accounts and the name of the individual associated with each account; list of conditions for group and role membership; notifications or records of recently transferred, separated, or terminated employees; list of recently disabled system accounts along with the name of the individual associated with each account; access authorization records; account management compliance reviews; system monitoring/audit records; other relevant documents or records; procedures addressing least privilege; list of security functions (deployed in hardware, software, and firmware) and security-relevant information for which access must be explicitly authorized; list of system-generated privileged accounts; list of system administration personnel].

steps.title: Interview
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Personnel with account management responsibilities; system or network administrators; personnel with information security responsibilities; personnel with responsibilities for defining least privileges necessary to accomplish specified tasks].

steps.title: Test
steps.description: [SELECT FROM: Organizational processes for managing system accounts; mechanisms for implementing account management; mechanisms implementing least privilege functions; mechanisms prohibiting privileged access to the system].

assessment-activities.description: privileged accounts are identified.

props.value: access to privileged accounts is authorized in accordance with the principle of least privilege.

assessment-activities.title: 3.1.5[c] – (Access Control)
assessment-activities.description: security functions are identified.

props.name: assessment-objective
props.value: access to security functions is authorized in accordance with the principle of least privilege.
